channel.title: Total Newby question
channel.description:
Hey everyone!
So I’m totally new to Kicksucure. I want to try it out and play around with it in a VM using Virt manager using Mint as the host OS. That way I can get a feel for it and download my apps.
I just can’t seem to figure out how to set a persistant VM though! Whenever I shutdown that VM then try to open it I get a black screen saying no bootable device found and have to delete and then spin up the VM again.
I have tried booting from a USB and still can’t figure out how to set a persistant mode. I would kinda like to use kicksecure as a daily driver.
Am I missing something?
Thanks for any and all help

item.title: Total Newby question
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Patrick:

Scratch that. No screenshot needed.

When you boot an ISO it is expected that there’s only live mode.

If you want persistent mode, you need to boot, install using Calamares to (virtual or real) hard drive, power off, remove ISO, reboot.

Also documented here:

Kicksecure – 2 Jul 25

ISO Live Mode for Kicksecure

ISO Live Mode for Kicksecure.

Read full topic

item.title: Total Newby question
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
• Black screen inside VM when using ISO: Try increase VM RAM.
  • VM images are pre-configured with sufficient RAM so there should be no black screen.

item.title: Total Newby question
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
There’s no special user action required for persistent mode. It’s the default.

Do you see the grub boot menu and after that nothing?

And then after booting only a black screen? In that case enable verbose boot messages for debugging as per Temporary Kernel Boot Parameter Change.
